title: NetHack-- 3.1.3
data:
**NetHack-- 3.1.3** is a [variant](/wiki/Variant "Variant") of [NetHack 3.1.3](/wiki/NetHack_3.1.3 "NetHack 3.1.3"), significant as an ancestor of [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"). Chris Herborth ported the changes from [NetHack-- 3.0.10](/wiki/NetHack--_3.0.10 "NetHack-- 3.0.10") and published the patch in August 1993.

[ ]

- [1 Availability](#Availability)

- [2 Significant changes](#Significant_changes)

- [3 The adventurer](#The_adventurer)

- [4 Dungeon features](#Dungeon_features)

  - [6.1 Artifacts](#Artifacts)

  - [6.7 Potions](#Potions)
  - [6.8 Scrolls](#Scrolls)
  - [6.9 Wands](#Wands)
  - [6.10 Spellbooks](#Spellbooks)
  - [6.11 Rings](#Rings)
  - [6.12 Stones](#Stones)
  - [6.13 Other items](#Other_items)

## Availability

The original Usenet postings are available on Google Groups:

- [Part 1](https://groups.google.com/g/rec.games.hack/c/S4rmQdHdchY/m/PjsIB4STiOUJ)
- [Part 2](https://groups.google.com/g/rec.games.hack/c/cnfVZcYjz5A/m/C2iWhiKD4WwJ)
- [Part 3](https://groups.google.com/g/rec.games.hack/c/o2iIc6o5rE0/m/EbYceXrhB0kJ)

These are shell archives bearing a patch to [NetHack 3.1.3](/wiki/NetHack_3.1.3 "NetHack 3.1.3").

## Significant changes

NetHack-- 3.1.3 adds new monsters, items, and dungeon features to [NetHack 3.1.3](/wiki/NetHack_3.1.3 "NetHack 3.1.3"). The extra roles that were available in [NetHack-- 3.0.10](/wiki/NetHack--_3.0.10 "NetHack-- 3.0.10") were not carried over, to avoid having to create new [Quests](/wiki/Quest "Quest") for them.

## The adventurer

The player may choose from these roles:

| Role                                              | Alignment |
| ------------------------------------------------- | --------- |
| [Archeologist](/wiki/Archeologist "Archeologist") | Lawful    |
| [Barbarian](/wiki/Barbarian "Barbarian")          | Neutral   |
| [Cave(wo)man](/wiki/Caveman "Caveman")            | Lawful    |
| [Elf](/wiki/Elf "Elf")                            | Chaotic   |
| [Healer](/wiki/Healer "Healer")                   | Neutral   |
| [Knight](/wiki/Knight "Knight")                   | Lawful    |
| [Priest(ess)](/wiki/Priest "Priest")              | Random    |
| [Rogue](/wiki/Rogue "Rogue")                      | Chaotic   |
| [Samurai](/wiki/Samurai "Samurai")                | Lawful    |
| [Tourist](/wiki/Tourist "Tourist")                | Neutral   |
| [Valkyrie](/wiki/Valkyrie "Valkyrie")             | Neutral   |
| [Wizard](/wiki/Wizard "Wizard")                   | Neutral   |

[NetHack-- 3.0.10](/wiki/NetHack--_3.0.10 "NetHack-- 3.0.10") had provided nine new roles, but these were not carried over, because it would have been necessary to create new [Quests](/wiki/Quest "Quest").

All classes permit male and female adventurers, except the Valkyrie which must be female.

The adventurer has [experience](/wiki/Experience "Experience"), [hit points](/wiki/Hit_points "Hit points"), [magical energy](/wiki/Magical_energy "Magical energy"), [armor class](/wiki/Armor_class "Armor class"), [alignment](/wiki/Alignment "Alignment"), and the six major [attributes](/wiki/Attribute "Attribute"). He may advance to [experience level](/wiki/Experience_level "Experience level") 30.

The initial [pet](/wiki/Pet "Pet") is a little [dog](/wiki/Dog "Dog") for Cavemen and Samurai, a [kitten](/wiki/Kitten "Kitten") for Wizards, and a random choice of the two (or the user's choice in his [options](/wiki/Options "Options")) for all others.

## Dungeon features

The main trunk of the dungeon begins at level 1, where the game begins, and proceeds down [stairs](/wiki/Stairs "Stairs") to [Medusa's Lair](/wiki/Medusa%27s_Lair "Medusa's Lair") and the [Castle](/wiki/Castle "Castle"). From there, it is necessary to enter a [trap door](/wiki/Trap_door "Trap door") to the [Valley of the Dead](/wiki/Valley_of_the_Dead "Valley of the Dead"). Further stairs down eventually lead to the invocation level. Performing the [invocation ritual](/wiki/Invocation_ritual "Invocation ritual") at the [vibrating square](/wiki/Vibrating_square "Vibrating square") opens the stairs to the [Sanctum](/wiki/Sanctum "Sanctum").

With the [Amulet of Yendor](/wiki/Amulet_of_Yendor "Amulet of Yendor") in hand, the adventurer may ascend from level 1 into the [Plane of Earth](/wiki/Plane_of_Earth "Plane of Earth"); thence s/he may proceed through [magic portals](/wiki/Magic_portal "Magic portal") to the planes of [Air](/wiki/Plane_of_Air "Plane of Air"), [Fire](/wiki/Plain_of_Fire "Plain of Fire"), and [Water](/wiki/Plain_of_Water "Plain of Water"), and thence to the [Astral Plane](/wiki/Astral_Plane "Astral Plane"). Offering the [Amulet of Yendor](/wiki/Amulet_of_Yendor "Amulet of Yendor") on the correct [high altar](/wiki/High_altar "High altar") wins the game.

Along the way, one will encounter these branches and special levels:

- A second [stair](/wiki/Stair "Stair") to the [Gnomish Mines](/wiki/Gnomish_Mines "Gnomish Mines"). Therein, one will find [Mine Town](/wiki/Mine_Town "Mine Town") and, at the end, the bottom level with a [luckstone](/wiki/Luckstone "Luckstone").

* The [Oracle level](/wiki/Oracle_\(level\) "Oracle (level)").

- A possible [Bigroom](/wiki/Bigroom "Bigroom").

* The [Rogue level](/wiki/Rogue_level "Rogue level").

- The [magic portal](/wiki/Magic_portal "Magic portal") to the [Quest](/wiki/Quest "Quest").

* A possible [magic portal](/wiki/Magic_portal "Magic portal"), inside a [vault](/wiki/Vault "Vault"), to [Fort Ludios](/wiki/Fort_Ludios "Fort Ludios").

- [Medusa's Lair](/wiki/Medusa%27s_Lair "Medusa's Lair").

* The [Castle](/wiki/Castle "Castle").

- The [Valley of the Dead](/wiki/Valley_of_the_Dead "Valley of the Dead"). [Gehennom](/wiki/Gehennom "Gehennom") begins here, and it is no longer safe to [pray](/wiki/Pray "Pray").

* The lairs of [Asmodeus](/wiki/Asmodeus "Asmodeus"), [Juiblex](/wiki/Juiblex "Juiblex"), [Baalzebub](/wiki/Baalzebub "Baalzebub"), and [Orcus](/wiki/Orcus "Orcus").

- A second upward [staircase](/wiki/Stairs "Stairs") to [Vlad's Tower](/wiki/Vlad%27s_Tower "Vlad's Tower").

* The [Wizard's Tower](/wiki/Wizard%27s_Tower "Wizard's Tower"); it is visible but not accessible from here.

- A [Fake Tower](/wiki/Fake_Tower "Fake Tower") containing a random [Amulet](/wiki/Amulet "Amulet").

* A [Fake Tower](/wiki/Fake_Tower "Fake Tower") containing a [magic portal](/wiki/Magic_portal "Magic portal") by which the Wizard's Tower may be entered.

To win the game, it is necessary to complete these tasks:

- Gather seven candles, possibly in the [lighting shop](/wiki/Lighting_shop "Lighting shop") (not yet tended by [Izchak](/wiki/Izchak "Izchak")) in [Mine Town](/wiki/Mine_Town "Mine Town").

* Complete the [Quest](/wiki/Quest "Quest") and get the [Bell of Opening](/wiki/Bell_of_Opening "Bell of Opening").

- Obtain the [Candelabrum of Invocation](/wiki/Candelabrum_of_Invocation "Candelabrum of Invocation") from [Vlad the Impaler](/wiki/Vlad_the_Impaler "Vlad the Impaler").

* Obtain the [Book of the Dead](/wiki/Book_of_the_Dead "Book of the Dead") from the [Wizard of Yendor](/wiki/Wizard_of_Yendor "Wizard of Yendor").

- Proceed to the [vibrating square](/wiki/Vibrating_square "Vibrating square") and perform the [invocation ritual](/wiki/Invocation_ritual "Invocation ritual").

* Obtain the [Amulet of Yendor](/wiki/Amulet_of_Yendor "Amulet of Yendor") from the [high priest](/wiki/High_priest "High priest") of [Moloch](/wiki/Moloch "Moloch").

- Escape from the dungeon.

* Pass through the [Elemental Planes](/wiki/Elemental_Planes "Elemental Planes").

- Arrive at the correct [altar](/wiki/Altar "Altar") in the [Astral Plane](/wiki/Astral_Plane "Astral Plane").

* Offer the [Amulet of Yendor](/wiki/Amulet_of_Yendor "Amulet of Yendor") to the god of your [alignment](/wiki/Alignment "Alignment").

[Special rooms](/wiki/Special_room "Special room"), new additions to [NetHack 3.1.3](/wiki/NetHack_3.1.3 "NetHack 3.1.3") noted in boldface, are:

A [wand of wishing](/wiki/Wand_of_wishing "Wand of wishing") is guaranteed in the [Castle](/wiki/Castle "Castle"), in its modern position, and protected by [Elbereth](/wiki/Elbereth "Elbereth"), but not tucked inside a [chest](/wiki/Chest "Chest").

Monsters removed were the nine added roles, plus Berthold the Gnome King, Bigfoot, and Cerberus.

The [gnome king](/wiki/Gnome_king "Gnome king") had been called "gnome prince" in [NetHack-- 3.0.10](/wiki/NetHack--_3.0.10 "NetHack-- 3.0.10"). Here it becomes "gnome king" again.

The [ki-rin](/wiki/Ki-rin "Ki-rin") was present in NetHack-- 3.0.10 with appearance u. It was added to [NetHack 3.1.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.1.0 "NetHack 3.1.0") as A and becomes such here.

The plain demon was present in NetHack-- 3.0.10 and [NetHack 3.0.10](/wiki/NetHack_3.0.10 "NetHack 3.0.10") only when the INFERNO option was turned off. This option was removed and the different demons made unconditional in [NetHack 3.1.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.1.0 "NetHack 3.1.0"). The plain demon is added back here.

html:
NetHack-- 3.1.3

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search

NetHack-- 3.1.3 is a variant of NetHack 3.1.3, significant as an ancestor of SLASH'EM. Chris Herborth ported the changes from NetHack-- 3.0.10 and published the patch in August 1993.

Contents

  • 1 Availability
  • 2 Significant changes
  • 3 The adventurer
  • 4 Dungeon features
  • 5 Bestiary
  • 6 Objects
    • 6.1 Artifacts
    • 6.2 Amulets
    • 6.3 Food
    • 6.4 Weapons
    • 6.5 Tools
    • 6.6 Armor
    • 6.7 Potions
    • 6.8 Scrolls
    • 6.9 Wands
    • 6.10 Spellbooks
    • 6.11 Rings
    • 6.12 Stones
    • 6.13 Other items

Availability

The original Usenet postings are available on Google Groups:

  • Part 1
  • Part 2
  • Part 3

These are shell archives bearing a patch to NetHack 3.1.3.

Significant changes

NetHack-- 3.1.3 adds new monsters, items, and dungeon features to NetHack 3.1.3. The extra roles that were available in NetHack-- 3.0.10 were not carried over, to avoid having to create new Quests for them.

The adventurer

The player may choose from these roles:

Role Alignment
Archeologist Lawful
Barbarian Neutral
Cave(wo)man Lawful
Elf Chaotic
Healer Neutral
Knight Lawful
Priest(ess) Random
Rogue Chaotic
Samurai Lawful
Tourist Neutral
Valkyrie Neutral
Wizard Neutral

NetHack-- 3.0.10 had provided nine new roles, but these were not carried over, because it would have been necessary to create new Quests.

All classes permit male and female adventurers, except the Valkyrie which must be female.

The adventurer has experience, hit points, magical energy, armor class, alignment, and the six major attributes. He may advance to experience level 30.

The initial pet is a little dog for Cavemen and Samurai, a kitten for Wizards, and a random choice of the two (or the user's choice in his options) for all others.

Dungeon features

The main trunk of the dungeon begins at level 1, where the game begins, and proceeds down stairs to Medusa's Lair and the Castle. From there, it is necessary to enter a trap door to the Valley of the Dead. Further stairs down eventually lead to the invocation level. Performing the invocation ritual at the vibrating square opens the stairs to the Sanctum.

With the Amulet of Yendor in hand, the adventurer may ascend from level 1 into the Plane of Earth; thence s/he may proceed through magic portals to the planes of Air, Fire, and Water, and thence to the Astral Plane. Offering the Amulet of Yendor on the correct high altar wins the game.

Along the way, one will encounter these branches and special levels:

  • A second stair to the Gnomish Mines. Therein, one will find Mine Town and, at the end, the bottom level with a luckstone.
  • The Oracle level.
  • A possible Bigroom.
  • The Rogue level.
  • The magic portal to the Quest.
  • A possible magic portal, inside a vault, to Fort Ludios.
  • Medusa's Lair.
  • The Castle.
  • The Valley of the Dead. Gehennom begins here, and it is no longer safe to pray.
  • The lairs of Asmodeus, Juiblex, Baalzebub, and Orcus.
  • A second upward staircase to Vlad's Tower.
  • The Wizard's Tower; it is visible but not accessible from here.
  • A Fake Tower containing a random Amulet.
  • A Fake Tower containing a magic portal by which the Wizard's Tower may be entered.

To win the game, it is necessary to complete these tasks:

  • Gather seven candles, possibly in the lighting shop (not yet tended by Izchak) in Mine Town.
  • Complete the Quest and get the Bell of Opening.
  • Obtain the Candelabrum of Invocation from Vlad the Impaler.
  • Obtain the Book of the Dead from the Wizard of Yendor.
  • Proceed to the vibrating square and perform the invocation ritual.
  • Obtain the Amulet of Yendor from the high priest of Moloch.
  • Escape from the dungeon.
  • Pass through the Elemental Planes.
  • Arrive at the correct altar in the Astral Plane.
  • Offer the Amulet of Yendor to the god of your alignment.

Special rooms, new additions to NetHack 3.1.3 noted in boldface, are:

  • throne room
  • swamp
  • vault
  • beehive
  • crypt
  • barracks
  • treasure zoo

  • temple
  • wasp hive
  • giant court
  • leprechaun court
  • bad food shop (this is not a shop in the usual sense)
  • real zoo
  • anthill
  • Room 11
  • shop

A wand of wishing is guaranteed in the Castle, in its modern position, and protected by Elbereth, but not tucked inside a chest.

Monsters removed were the nine added roles, plus Berthold the Gnome King, Bigfoot, and Cerberus.

The gnome king had been called "gnome prince" in NetHack-- 3.0.10. Here it becomes "gnome king" again.

The ki-rin was present in NetHack-- 3.0.10 with appearance u. It was added to NetHack 3.1.0 as A and becomes such here.

The plain demon was present in NetHack-- 3.0.10 and NetHack 3.0.10 only when the INFERNO option was turned off. This option was removed and the different demons made unconditional in NetHack 3.1.0. The plain demon is added back here.
